title: Support, the most blames role.
body:
After playing support main from early days bronze to gold 2 there's one thing I've learnt. That support is the most blamed and hated role in the entire game.

No matter what you do, how well you play, how much you ward etc it is ALWAYS your fault somehow some way. It's so frustrating and tilting to play I can see why others lash out and get perma banned from the constant blame that ensues when someone dies in the general vicinity.

People don't seem to understand that you are merely their to assist the team and them in laning phase. Just because your support is around doesn't mean you can blindly run into unwarded brushes, engage into a 3v2 etc and try be a hero all game long.

Also I keep hearing that a good support can carry games, but in all honesty I really don't believe that at lower elo's. It's just not possible to carry a game as a support champ when your top or mid lane has fed the enemy team 10+ kills. Maybe at higher elo's where people don't make ridiculous plays and actually look at their map it's true.
